div.p: 2. The compound for its use according to claim 1 wherein the method of modulating an immune response decreases the production of a cytokine.
3. The compound for its use according to claim 2 wherein the cytokine is chosen from TNFalpha, IL-1Beta, IL-1alpha, IL-8, IL-6, IL-10, IL-11, IL-12, TGF-Beta, and IFNgamma.
4. The compound for its use according to one of claims 1-3 wherein the immune response is against an oral pathogen.

5. The compound for its use according to claim 4 wherein the oral pathogen is chosen from Aggregatibacter actinomycetemcomitans, Porphyromonas gingivalis, Streptococcus sanguis, Candida albicans, Actinomyces viscosus, Lactobacillus casei,
and Strept. mutans.
6. The compound for its use according to one of claims 1-3 wherein the immune response is against a bacterial pathogen.

7. The compound for its use according to claim 6 wherein the bacterial pathogen is chosen from S. aureus, methicillin-resistant S. aureus, S. epidermidis, Strept. pneumoniae, Strept. pyogenes, Strept. viridans, E. coli, E. faecalis, E. faecium, P. aeruginosa, A. baumannii, Haemophilus influenzae, Serratia marcescens, Moraxella catarrhalis, Klebsiella pneumoniae, Proteus vulgaris, Proteus mirabilis, Bacteroides fragalis, Clostridium difficile, Clostridium perfringens,
and P. acnes.
2. The compound for its use according to claim 1 wherein the method of modulating an immune response decreases the production of a cytokine.

3. The compound for its use according to claim 2 wherein the cytokine is chosen from TNFalpha, IL-1Beta,
IL-1alpha, IL-8, IL-6, IL-10, IL-11, IL-12, TGF-Beta, and IFNgamma.
4. The compound for its use according to one of claims 1-3 wherein the immune response is against an oral pathogen.

5. The compound for its use according to claim 4 wherein the oral pathogen is chosen from Aggregatibacter actinomycetemcomitans, Porphyromonas gingivalis, Streptococcus sanguis, Candida albicans, Actinomyces viscosus, Lactobacillus casei,
and Strept. mutans.
6. The compound for its use according to one of claims 1-3 wherein the immune response is against a bacterial pathogen.

7. The compound for its use according to claim 6 wherein the bacterial pathogen is chosen from S. aureus, methicillin-resistant S. aureus, S. epidermidis, Strept. pneumoniae, Strept. pyogenes, Strept. viridans, E. coli, E. faecalis, E. faecium, P. aeruginosa, A. baumannii, Haemophilus influenzae, Serratia marcescens, Moraxella catarrhalis, Klebsiella pneumoniae, Proteus vulgaris, Proteus mirabilis, Bacteroides fragalis, Clostridium difficile, Clostridium perfringens,
and P. acnes.
